2025-12-11.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**: Conversational Agents now supports log splitting for [large Cloud Logging log entries](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/agent-settings#logging-settings).

summary.title: Agent log splitting support
summary.summary: Conversational agents now support log splitting for large Cloud Logging log entries. This feature enhances the management and analysis of conversation logs.

2025-12-11.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**: Dialogflow CX Messenger [integration](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/integration/dialogflow-messenger) contained a vulnerability that allowed for authentication bypass when an agent was configured to use an authenticated API with a 3rd party identity. **All versions released after August 20th, 2025 have been updated to protect from this vulnerability. No user action is required.**

summary.title: Security update for Dialogflow CX
summary.summary: A security vulnerability in Dialogflow CX Messenger has been addressed. Versions released after August 20th, 2025, are now protected, and no user action is needed.

2025-12-11.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**: New *Responsible AI* fields are now available for the [`v3`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/reference/rpc/google.cloud.dialogflow.cx.v3#raisettings) and [`v3beta1`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/reference/rpc/google.cloud.dialogflow.cx.v3beta1#raisettings) API endpoints. Responsible AI allows you to flag, filter or block harmful content.

summary.title: New Responsible AI features for conversational agents
summary.summary: Responsible AI fields are now available for Dialogflow CX API endpoints. This feature allows you to flag, filter, or block harmful content within your conversational agents, enhancing safety and control.

2025-11-06.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**:You can now specify custom voice in the **Conversation profiles** menu in the console.

summary.title: Custom Voice for Dialogflow CX
summary.summary: Users can now select custom voices for their conversational agents within the Dialogflow CX console's Conversation profiles menu.

2025-10-23.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**: The **Entity Types** console menu now allows you to set a page size for entity entries and excluded phrases. Pagination options are automatically displayed if there are more than 10 items listed.

summary.title: Entity Types Pagination
summary.summary: Set a page size for entity entries and excluded phrases in Dialogflow CX's Entity Types console. Pagination appears automatically for more than 10 items.

2025-10-23.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**:The [Block none](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/agent-settings) safety feature in agent settings is no longer restricted access.

summary.title: Dialogflow CX: Safety Feature Now Widely Available
summary.summary: The safety feature in agent settings for Dialogflow CX, previously with restricted access, is now available to all users. This enhancement aims to provide broader access to robust safety controls within conversational agent development.

2025-10-23.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**: New fields `temperature`, `input_token_limit` and `output_token_limit` are now available for [`LlmModelSettings`](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/reference/rpc/google.cloud.dialogflow.cx.v3beta1#llmmodelsettings) in the v3beta1 API. This allows you to adjust the model per playbook.

summary.title: New LLM Settings in Dialogflow CX
summary.summary: Dialogflow CX now offers new fields like temperature, input, and output token limits for LlmModelSettings in the v3beta1 API, enabling per-playbook model adjustments.

2025-10-23.content: **Conversational Agents (Dialogflow CX)**: You can now configure service account authorization for both tools and webhooks. See the [reference documentation](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/reference/rpc/google.cloud.dialogflow.cx.v3#serviceaccountauthconfig) for details.

summary.title: Service account authorization for Dialogflow CX
summary.summary: You can now configure service account authorization for tools and webhooks in Dialogflow CX.

2025-10-16.content: **Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents)**: The [Dialogflow CX console](https://dialogflow.cloud.google.com/cx/projects) will be deprecated on **October 31, 2025**. After that date all users will be automatically routed to the [Conversational Agents console](https://conversational-agents.cloud.google.com/projects).

summary.title: Dialogflow CX Console Deprecation
summary.summary: The Dialogflow CX console is being deprecated on October 31, 2025. Users will be automatically redirected to the Conversational Agents console after this date.

2025-10-16.content:
**Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents)**: The default models for data stores and playbooks have been upgraded as follows:

* Data stores

  + Default voice mode summarization from `gemini-2.0-flash-lite-001` to `gemini-2.5-flash-lite`.
  + Default text mode summarization from `gemini-2.0-flash-001` to `gemini-2.5-flash`.
  + Default text mode rewriter from `gemini-2.0-flash-lite-001` to `gemini-2.5-flash-lite`.
* Playbooks:

  + All newly-created playbooks use default model `gemini-2.5-flash`.

summary.title: Dialogflow CX Model Upgrades
summary.summary: Models for data stores and playbooks in Dialogflow CX have been updated. This includes upgrades to default summarization and rewriter models for data stores, and a new default model for playbooks.

2025-09-04.content: **Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents)**: *This is a correction of the release note posted on [August 7, 2025](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/release-notes#August_07_2025)*. All deactivated models are now automatically upgraded to model `gemini- 2.5-flash` with the exception of **generative fallback**, which is automatically upgraded to `gemini-2.5-flash-lite`.

summary.title: Dialogflow CX Update
summary.summary: Dialogflow CX models have been updated. Deactivated models are now automatically upgraded to gemini-2.5-flash, with generative fallback upgraded to gemini-2.5-flash-lite.

2025-09-04.content:
**Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents)**: The following regions are now available:

* `asia-southeast2`
* `europe-west4`
* `europe-west6`

summary.title: New Dialogflow CX regions available
summary.summary: We are announcing the expansion of Dialogflow CX availability to three new regions: asia-southeast2, europe-west4, and europe-west6.

2025-09-04.content: **Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents)**: New prompt security controls are available in **agent settings**. See the [agent settings documentation](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/agent-settings#settings-generative-prompt-security) for details.

summary.title: New Prompt Security Controls in Dialogflow CX
summary.summary: Dialogflow CX now offers enhanced prompt security controls within agent settings. These new features help secure your conversational agents by providing better management over prompts. For more details, refer to the agent settings documentation.

2025-09-04.content:
**Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents)** The [model](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions) `gemini-2.5-flash-lite` is now available in all regions, and `gemini-2.5-flash` is now GA. These changes apply to the following features:

* Generators
* Playbooks
* Data store tools

summary.title: Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite Now Available
summary.summary: Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite is now accessible in all regions. Gemini 2.5 Flash is now generally available. These updates impact Generators, Playbooks, and Data store tools.

2025-08-07.content:
**Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI**: The `gemini-1.0-pro`, `gemini-1.5-pro` and `gemini-1.5-flash` models will be deprecated on **September 1, 2025** and automatically upgraded to the `gemini-2.0-flash-001` model. This change applies to Vertex AI agents and the following Conversational Agents generative features:

* Playbooks
* Data stores
* Generators
* Generative Fallback

After the upgrade on September 1, 2024, `gemini-2.0-flash-001` will be automatically selected in the console. We recommend that you upgrade to the new model early to allow enough time for testing and to ensure that your solution works as intended.

summary.title: Model Deprecation in Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI
summary.summary: The gemini-1.0-pro, gemini-1.5-pro and gemini-1.5-flash models in Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI will be deprecated on September 1, 2025 and automatically upgraded to the gemini-2.0-flash-001 model.

summary.title: New feature
summary.summary: Routine playbooks for Dialogflow CX are now available.

2025-07-31.content: **Conversational Agents**: [Parameter passing](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/playbook/parameter#passing-parameters) is now available and documented between routine playbooks, task playbooks, and flows.

summary.title: Parameter Passing in Conversational Agents
summary.summary: Parameter passing is now available between routine playbooks, task playbooks, and flows.

2025-07-24.content: **Conversational Agents**: 21 new [Chirp 3 HD voices](https://cloud.google.com/text-to-speech/docs/chirp3-hd) are now available across 34 locales.

summary.title: New Voices Available
summary.summary: Introducing new HD voices for conversational agents.

2025-07-24.content: **Conversational Agents data stores**: Conversational Agents now supports AlloyDB AI, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner and Cloud SQL data store source as public GA features; Microsoft Entra ID source has now private GA support. See the [data store documentation](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/data-store) for a complete list.

summary.title: Conversational Agents data stores update
summary.summary: New data store options for conversational agents.

2025-07-17.content: **Conversational Agents**: CMEK is now available in EU regions.

summary.title: CMEK now in EU
summary.summary: CMEK for conversational agents is now available in EU regions.

2025-07-17.content: **Conversational Agents**: The [conversational history flow analysis feature](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/conversation-history#flow-analysis-table) is now available.

summary.title: New Flow Analysis Feature
summary.summary: Analyze conversation history with the new flow analysis feature for conversational agents.

2025-07-17.content:
**Conversational Agents**: The [model](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions) `gemini-2.5-flash` is now available in all regions. This change applies to the following features:

* Generators
* Playbooks (Public Preview)
* Data stores tools (Public Preview)

summary.title: Gemini 2.5 Flash Now Available in All Regions
summary.summary: The Gemini 2.5 Flash model is now available in all regions for features including Generators, Playbooks (Public Preview), and Data Stores tools (Public Preview).

2025-06-26.content: **Conversational Agents data stores**: Conversational Agents now supports AlloyDB, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner and Cloud SQL [data store sources](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/data-store#sources) as public GA features. Microsoft Entra ID source has now private GA support.

summary.title: New data store sources available in Dialogflow CX
summary.summary: Dialogflow CX has added support for several new data store sources, including AlloyDB, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner, and Cloud SQL, as public GA features. Microsoft Entra ID now has private GA support.

2025-06-26.content: **Conversational Agents data stores**: You can now create some data store types directly within the Conversational Agents console rather than needing to use AI Applications. See the [data store creation documentation](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/data-store/handler#data-store-console) for details.

summary.title: Data Stores Now Available in Conversational Agents Console
summary.summary: You can now create data stores directly in the Conversational Agents console, simplifying the process. Previously, this required using AI Applications.

2025-06-12.content: **Conversational Agents**: New [Chirp 3 HD](https://cloud.google.com/text-to-speech/docs/chirp3-hd) Cloud Text-to-Speech voice **Autonoe** is now available.

summary.title: New Autonoe voice available
summary.summary: Autonoe, a new voice from Cloud Text-to-Speech, is now available. This voice is part of the Chirp 3 HD family.

2025-06-12.content: **Conversational Agents**: Conversational Agents console now supports [test cases](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/test-case).

summary.title: Test Cases for Conversational Agents
summary.summary: You can now use test cases to test your conversational agents in the console.

2025-06-12.content: **Conversational Agents**: Service agent access tokens used for authentication by both webhooks and tools are now discontinued as mentioned in notification emails to customers earlier this year. Most customers can use service accounts instead.

summary.title: Access Tokens for Conversational Agents Discontinued
summary.summary: Service agent access tokens for conversational agents are no longer supported and have been discontinued. Service accounts are now recommended for authentication.

2025-06-12.content: **Data store handlers**: Data store handler use tracking for billing purposes has been corrected.

summary.title: Data store billing tracking corrected
summary.summary: Tracking for billing purposes in data store handlers has been corrected.
